Key Arguments: The proposed legislation may overreach and impact freedom of speech and privacy.
The powers granted to ACMA could intrude on personal data and privacy rights.
An enforceable code of practice by ACMA might stifle legitimate speech and diverse perspectives.
Stronger regulation could disproportionately burden smaller digital platforms and limit innovation.
News media should also be subject to the same obligations and standards as digital platforms.
Notable Quotes: The proposed powers granted to the Australian Communications and Media Authority (ACMA) raise concerns about potential overreach and their impact on freedom of speech and the open exchange of ideas.
A code of practice enforced by the ACMA could have a chilling effect on freedom of expression, hindering public discourse rather than fostering a healthy information ecosystem.
It is crucial to acknowledge that news media outlets also play a significant role in spreading misinformation and disinformation.
